intro: Rafinesquia obovata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf prairie coneflower, is a flowering plant native to the central and western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny prairies and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and obovate, with a hairy texture, and it produces a tall, sparsely branched stem. Rafinesquia obovata is often used in native plant gardens for its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
